item.title: Morgan Stanley Sees $200B Market For Self-Driving Cars by 2030
item.description: Morgan Stanley analysts forecast that the market for self-driving vehicles will hit $200 billion by 2030. Analysts Adam Jonas and Tim Hsiao say sales of autonomous cars with Level 2 and above autonomy

item.title: Morgan Stanley Issues First Panda Bond by a US Company
item.description: Morgan Stanley has become the first American company to tap China’s panda bond market, with a 2 billion yuan ($279 million) deal.

item.title: Morgan Stanley Revives $4 Billion Finastra Debt Refinancing Plan
item.description: Morgan Stanley is reviving an effort to refinance roughly $4 billion of private loans for financial software firm Finastra Group Holdings Ltd., according to people familiar with the transaction.

item.title: Dollar Hedging May Push Euro to $1.30, Morgan Stanley Says
item.description: The euro’s rally is about to get another boost, according to Morgan Stanley strategists, as European investors look to hedge nearly $4 trillion of US assets.

item.title: Citadel Securities Big Move in Derivatives Dominance
item.description: Citadel Securities is buying Morgan Stanley’s unit focused on electronic market-making for US equity options. The move expands the firm’s already dominant role in the market. Bloomberg’s Sridhar Natar
